data.title: The 17 Best Persian Romantic Movies
data.meta_description: Introduction of best Persian romantic films from popular Iranian directors such as Asghar Farhadi, Mohammad Hossein Lotfi 1.Tala (2010) 2.Leila (1997)
data.text:
One of the most well-liked film productions with a large and steadily growing fan base is Iranian romance. Iranian romantic family movies have been created in large quantities recently, and some of them have received numerous accolades. Stay with us as we introduce the top romantic Iranian movies if you share our enthusiasm for these films.

The most endearing romantic Iranian films are listed below, each of which has its own charm. You can also pick your favorite film from the ones that were mentioned and watch it:

1.Tala (2010)

One of the top Iranian romantic movies with a sprinkle of comedy that attracted a lot of attention is Tala. This romantic and socially conscious film managed to have a successful box office run. The makers of this brand-new Iranian love drama are Mohammad Shaisteh, Rambod Javan, and Parviz Shahbazi.

A group of friends wanting to build a restaurant together is the subject of the film. For a share of this effort, each of them contributed money to the middle.

Two of them are in a romantic relationship, which leads to challenging situations and risky choices. Negar Javaherian, Mehrdad Sediqian, Tanaz Tabatabaei, Ehteram Boroumand, Houman Seyedi, Hoda Zainul Abedin, and Reza Sha’baanpour are among the actors in the movie Tala.

2.Butterfly Stroke (2020)

One of the best Iranian romantic movies which induce a feeling of sadness is Butterfly Swimming. Although this film begins with a social genre, its primary focus is Hashem’s intense love for his wife. Excessive love spirals into craziness and creates a host of issues.

Butterfly Stroke is directed by Mohammad Kart, while Rasool Sadr Aamili is the film’s producer. This Iranian love film tells the tale of Parvaneh, a lady who unintentionally discovers a video of herself swimming in the pool. With the aid of his pals, his wife Hashem went to that pool and wreaked havoc in an effort to exact revenge.

3.Intoxicated Eye (2020)

Nargese Mast, or Intoxicated Eye in English, is yet another of Iran’s best romantic movies. The Namava and Filmo platforms hosted the release of this film online. Intoxicated Eye is on the list of the most seductive Iranian romantic comedies, and music plays a significant role in this film.

The movie Narges Mast, which they produced and directed and which is based on the lives of four modern poets, was written and directed by Jalaluddin Dari, with Abdullah Esfandiari serving as producer.

Among the actors of the movie Intoxicated Eye, we can mention Mitra Hajjar, Mehdi Pakdel, Reza Fayaazi, Saeed Poursamimi, Metin Sotoudeh, Houman Barghnavard, Siamak Safari, Amir Hossein Modares and Behnam Ghorbaani.

4.Latyan (2020)

Latyan, one of the best Iranian romantic comedies, could have surely had strong box office success, but it suffered a severe setback due to the Coronavirus.

The cinema’s closing prevented the release of the Latyan movie. One of the best Iranian romance films is this one, which was produced and directed by Majid Matlabi.

In this film, the writer was able to combine a romantic theme with a mysterious concept. Parinaz Izadiyar, Hassan Majouni, Sara Bahrami, Amir Jadidi, Setereh Pesiaani, and Alireza Saanifar are among the actors in this drama movie. This social romance movie follows a typical plot.

5.African Violet (2019)

One of the top Iranian romantic comedies is called African Violet. Although this movie is primarily pitched as a social drama, it also has love undertones. Fateme Motamedarya portrays Shokouh, a housewife who makes an odd choice with the approval of her second husband.

She came to his residence to care for his ex-wife, who resides in a nursing home. The film’s fresh developments will start with this insane decision of glory.

African Violet, directed by Mona Zandi Haqiqi and produced by Alireza Shojanoori, managed to attract many audiences. Among the other actors in this movie, which is one of the best Iranian romantic movies, we can mention Reza Babak, Neda Jabraili, Roya Jaavidnia, Mehdi Hosseininia, and Maryam Shirazi.

6.Duet (2016)

One of the best Iranian romantic movies from Iran is called Duet. Navid Danesh, the Duet director, should be regarded as having just started out. Duet is regarded by many fans as one of the best romantic comedies from Iran. By looking at them, you can’t tell what their intentions are, and this rhythm will last until the film’s conclusion.

It should be acknowledged that the plot of the film Duet is about a middle-aged man and woman who fell in love while they were students. But for whatever reason, they parted ways. After a long separation, they are now confronting each other, each of them married and leading separate lives.

7.Lottery (2018)

Undoubtedly one of Mohammad Hossein Mahdavian’s most popular films is Lottery. This film communicates its message in an enormous and depressing setting with a social and romantic flair. This piece was filmed in Iran, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates.

In this film, Amir Ali and Noushin, two twenty-one-year-olds, are seen to be intending to wed but are opposed by their families. These two young individuals had been waiting for their family’s approval.

Both of them have lottery tickets and are hoping to win this contest, but Noushin is unexpectedly dispatched to Dubai by his father’s acquaintance for work. Amir Ali eventually finds out Noushin committed suicide. He goes to Dubai to investigate the problem and finds that there was no suicide and there is another problem.

8.When the Moon Was Full (2019)

The night when the moon was full is one of the best Iranian romantic movies. A young girl from the south of Tehran is the subject of the film “The Night the Moon Was Full.” He experiences love. This is true even if he was compelled to leave Iran after getting married for various reasons. Based on the real-life experiences of Abdul Hamid Rigi and his wife Faiza Mansouri, this film.

One of the best Iranian romantic comedies features Elnaz Shakerdoost, Houtan Shakiba, Fereshte Sadr Arafaei, Pedram Sharifi, and Shabnam Moghadami among its key cast.

9.A Few Cubic Meters of Love (2014)

2013 saw the release of the charming and lovely film “a few cubic meters of love.” Although this film has a beautiful tone and a romantic aesthetic, its romance is unavoidably tinged with bitterness.

“A few cubic meters of love” was created jointly by Iranian and Afghan filmmakers and was written in both Dari and Farsi. Abdul Salam, an Afghan immigrant who works in a workshop with his daughter Maruna, is the subject of the movie’s plot. Abdulsalam vehemently opposes Maruna’s decision to leave Iran once she decides to leave because of a romantic relationship.

This film has performances by actors like Saaed Sohaili, Hasiba Ebrahimi, Nader Fallah, Alireza Ostadi, Masoud Mirtaheri, Afshin Sulaimanpour, and Kazem Alizadeh.

10.Beautiful City (2004)

One of Asghar Farhadi’s best Iranian romantic movies is called Beautiful City. In the film Beautiful City, Asghar Farhadi portrays smooth and straightforward love in a delicate and tense scenario, making it one of the best emotional films produced in Iran.

Firouzeh, who divorced his wife because of his addiction, is trying to get his brother Akbar’s execution permission because he was charged with murder two years ago and is now 18 years old.

Akbar’s friend Alaa assists Firouzeh in gaining her approval. As a result, Alaa and Firouzeh start to show interest in one another. Will their relationship end happily? Beautiful city is one of the best and most well-known romantic films from Iran.

11.Santouri (2007)

Ali, a young man from a pious family who enjoys music and playing the Santoor, is the protagonist of the film Santoori. He pursues music despite his family’s opposition and is shunned by them. At the height of his popularity, Ali falls in love with Haniyeh, and the two eventually get married.

However, a monster known as addiction slowly grows the gap between this beloved couple, and they become embroiled in numerous issues. One of the best Iranian romantic comedies, this lovely film was able to draw a lot of interest from viewers.

12.Bomb: A Love Story (2018)

One of the best Iranian romantic movies is the romantic drama Bomb movie, the third feature film by filmmaker Peyman Ma’aadi. This movie’s plot takes place during the Iran-Iraq war and the bombings of Tehran, for which it won the Asia Pacific Film Festival’s prize for best writing.

The plot centers on Mitra and Iraj, a married couple who are having an extramarital relationship. However, at these times of anxiety and terror, they discover a means to communicate and a fresh start, and during the bombs, rather than gathering in the basement with other neighbors, they sit alone in the dark and share what they didn’t say.

13.Subdued (2017)

We may list Reg Khab, or subdued in English, as one of the top romantic films from Iran. In this film, Leila Hatami plays a woman named Mina who has divorced her husband and is currently looking for work to support herself. Mina, who doesn’t even have a place to stay, meets Kourosh Tahaami’s character, Kamran, who works as a restaurant manager.

Koroush makes an effort to assist Mina, and as a result, she begins to develop feelings for him. But with time, Mina comes to understand that their love is only mutual. The best Iranian romantic film was produced as a result of this one-sided passion.

14.What’s the Time in Your World? (2014)

One of the best romantic films from Iran is this one. This movie is about a girl named Goli who, after spending years away from her homeland, travels from France to Iran and the city of Rasht. One of Goli’s longtime friends, Farhad, has cared for her mother and been in love with her for years. Goli, though, can’t even recall him.

The return to the big screen of Zari Khoshkam, Leila Hatami’s mother and Ali Hatami’s wife, is one of the intriguing aspects of this film. Likewise, Kristof Rezaei has appeared in two roles. One of the best Iranian love films is this endearing one.

15.I’m Not Angry! (2014)

The “I’m Not Angry!” movie is one of the best Iranian romantic movies produced and managed to garner a lot of interest from viewers. In a sense, this is the first serious film of Navid Mohammadzadeh, a talented actor in Iranian cinema, and Reza Darmishian’s second full-length feature.

The narrative of the movie centers on Navid, a former student who is smitten with Setareh. Due to Navid’s circumstances and issues, Setareh and Navid, who have been engaged for some time, have been under pressure from Setareh’s father because they haven’t been able to get married yet.

16.Leila (1997)

One of the most well-known Iranian romantic movies is called Leila. Leila and Reza’s love journey is depicted in this film. These two people begin their basic but passionate relationship at the height of empathy. The situation is perfect up until they decide to become parents.

Here is where this couple’s adventures begin. Leila is unable to have kids. They visit the doctor frequently, take a variety of medications, and spend a lot of money, but they still experience no change. They manage it.

As they resume their regular activities, pleasure returns to their homes. Reza’s mother is pressuring Leila to find Reza a new wife being aware of how content her son is in this scenario. The principal performers are Mohammad Reza Sharifinia, Leila Hatami, Ali Musafa, Jamileh Sheikhi, Turan Mehrzad, Amir Payor, and Shaghayegh Farahani.

After indulging in the heartwarming tales of Iranian cinema, why not plan a romantic getaway? Discover the most enchanting destinations in Iran in autumn for a memorable experience with your loved one.

17.Heiran (2009)

This romantic Iranian film portrays the tale of a young Afghan man with high self-esteem. He wastes the money that would have gone toward his university tuition and his student ID by paying rent for a house that is not necessary. He becomes anonymous and an illegal immigrant following this incident. He embarks on a fresh journey in this regard.

One of the best Iranian romantic comedies, it stars Baran Kosari, Mehrdad Sedighian, Farhad Aslani, Khosro Shakibaei, and Zhale Sameti among other notable performers.
